title: Ingrebourne Valley Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: David Kemp / Ingrebourne River south of Upminster
images.caption: Ingrebourne River south of Upminster. The Ingrebourne rises near Brentwood and enters the Thames at Rainham having provided a rural corridor between the London suburbs of Emerson Park, Cranham, Upminster and Hornchurch en route. Taken from the London Loop footpath.

images.title: Alan Ford / Tett Turret at the former RAF Hornchurch
images.caption: Tett Turret at the former RAF Hornchurch. This lies on the eastern perimeter of one of the most important RAF fighter bases of World War II

description: This is a nice easy, family cycle ride or walk through the Ingrebourne Valley near Upminster. The route includes a stretch through Hornchurch Country Park with its ponds, lakes and pleasant scenery. You will also visit Ingrebourne Hill which offers brilliant views across the Thames and a variety of wildlife. Finally, there is a lovely stretch along the Ingrebourne River to enjoy, making for a peaceful, varied easy walk or ride. Good access points are the stations at Upminster and Rainham. The route is coincident with the London Loop which you can use to extend the walk if you have time.
